    • Method Detail

      • stopTransaction

        public void stopTransaction(TransactionalGraph.Conclusion conclusion)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionalGraph
        Stop the current transaction. Specify whether the transaction was successful or not. A failing transaction will rollback all updates to before the transaction was started.

        If there is currently no open transaction (i.e. no operations on the graph), then calling this method has no effect other than potentially re-initializing data structures.

        Specified by:
        stopTransaction in interface TransactionalGraph
        Parameters:
        conclusion - whether or not the current transaction was successful

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionalGraph

        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Description copied from interface: TransactionalGraph

      • autoStartTransaction

        protected void autoStartTransaction()

      • isAutoStartTx

        public boolean isAutoStartTx()
        Tells if a transaction is started automatically when the graph is changed. This affects only when a transaction hasn't been started. Default is true.
        Returns:

      • setAutoStartTx

        public void setAutoStartTx(boolean autoStartTx)
        If enabled auto starts a new transaction right before the graph is changed. This affects only when a transaction hasn't been started. Default is true.
        Parameters:
        autoStartTx -
